resources.string: Save front and rear as separate 16:9 videos
Take pictures with the exposure and color settings automatically set for you.
Preview all your lenses, record with the front and rear cameras at the same time, and create movies like a pro.
Record with the front and rear cameras at the same time to create movies like a pro.
Record smooth time-lapse videos to speed up things like sunsets, traffic, and more.
Record artistic videos with adjustable depths of focus.
Take stunning portraits by adjusting the background of your shots.
Pack more into each shot by making vertical or horizontal panoramas.
Take control of your videos. Set the exposure, shutter speed, color tone, and ISO sensitivity manually.
Take control of your pictures. Set the exposure, shutter speed, color tone, and ISO sensitivity manually.
Take artistic selfies that focus on your face.
Shoot scenes once to capture all the meaningful moments in a series of pics and short clips.
Record videos at a high frame rate which can be played in slow motion.
Slow down the action to soak in every moment.
Record videos with the exposure and color settings automatically set for you.
Capture more with a wider lens
Keep the Shutter button within reach
Photograph your world, top to bottom

This setting only affects Photo mode.
To open %s, enable the app in Settings.

Capture cinematic-quality videos using the Advanced Professional Video (APV) codec. APV recordings retain visually lossless clarity even after multiple rounds of editing, but require large amounts of storage space.
This setting adds an APV control to Video and Pro video modes.
Capture cinematic-quality videos using the Advanced Professional Video (APV) codec.
APV files are large, but you can use %s to record them without taking up space on your phone.
APV 422 HQ at FHD 30 fps uses about 1.5 GB per minute
APV 422 LQ at FHD 30 fps uses about 0.75 GB per minute

Increase the bitrate of videos recorded in Video and Pro video modes. High bitrate videos are usually larger than normal videos.
Reduce file size by saving videos in HEVC format instead of H.264 format. Some apps may not support HEVC format.
Choose how to save HEVC videos.
Prioritize video quality to capture more fine details. Prioritize saving space to make video files as small as possible.
Intelligent features only work with the rear camera in Photo mode.
Turn off Detail enhancer to use intelligent features.
"Intelligent features aren't available while using the camera through another app."
Start Camera in the last used mode, such as Video, instead of always starting in Photo mode.
Keep the exposure setting you last used instead of resetting it when you close Camera.
"Keep the filters you've applied to each mode instead of removing them when you close Camera."
Keep %1$d and %2$d MP resolutions applied instead of switching to the default resolution when you close Camera.
Keep 50 MP resolution applied instead of switching to the default resolution when you close Camera.
Keep %d MP resolution applied instead of switching to the default resolution when you close Camera.
Keep the zoom you last used for rear camera Portrait mode instead of always starting in the default zoom.
Keep the angle you last used for the front camera. The camera will no longer switch between normal and wide angles based on the number of people in the selfie.
If Super steady is on in Video mode, keep it on instead of turning it off when you close Camera.
"Add an extra Shutter button you can move anywhere on the screen so you can reach it with either hand. Hide it when you don't need it."
Your audio, video, and image files
For best results, stay within 1.5 - 5 feet of subject.
Location tags add geographical location data to your pictures and videos so you can search for and sort them based on where they were taken.
To add location tags to your shots, turn on Improve location accuracy.
Add tags to your pictures and videos so you can see where they were taken.
"Location turned off. To use location tags, turn on Location in the quick settings panel."
To add location tags to pictures and videos, Improve location accuracy needs to be turned on.

Add an option to record in Log format to the camera preview. Log format captures a wider dynamic range for more flexibility when editing. To record in Log format, both this setting and the option on the Camera preview need to be turned on.
Log videos will look flat and gray until you correct their color in Gallery.
Select which modes to add the Log recording option to.

Capture a wider dynamic range for more flexibility when editing. Log videos appear flat and gray until you correct their colors in an advanced video editor. To record in log, both this setting and the LOG icon at the top of the preview need to be turned on.
Wait for your phone to finish taking the picture.

Be careful when sharing pictures and videos that include location data because other people can see where they were taken.
Your pictures and videos will contain information about where they were taken, so be careful when sharing them.

Select which format to save Pro mode pictures in. No color tone adjustments are applied to RAW pictures.
"Save both JPEG and RAW copies of pictures taken in Pro mode. Color tone adjustments won't be shown in RAW copies."
Pictures and videos will now be saved to internal storage.
Pictures and videos will now be saved to your SD card.
Save selfies and selfie videos as they appear in the preview without flipping them.
"You don't have any presets yet. Go to Preset settings to create some."
Exposure controls how bright your pictures are. Higher values are brighter, but setting the EV too high can make pictures look faded.

"The false color exposure monitor uses colors to show exposure levels in the preview. Green means the area is properly exposed, red and yellow mean it's overexposed, and blue and magenta mean it's underexposed."
"Auto focus quickly adjusts to any scene or subject, even if they move. Manual focus gives you precise control over what's in focus."

"ISO sets the camera's sensitivity to light. Use a low ISO in bright environments to reduce graininess. In low light, use a higher ISO to increase brightness. Setting the ISO too high can cause graininess."
Shutter speed controls how long the shutter stays open. Use low values to capture moving subjects without blurring. Use high values to brighten low-light pictures or intentionally show motion blur.
White balance helps you make colors look natural in any light. Higher values make colors warmer and more orange. Lower values make colors cooler and bluer.
White balance and Tint help you make colors look natural in any light. Use White balance to make colors warmer or cooler, and use Tint to balance green and magenta.

The zebra pattern exposure monitor highlights overexposed areas in the preview with zebra stripes. You can adjust the IRE value to control the brightness sensitivity for your preferred exposure level.

To use Camera, you need to allow the following permissions in Settings:
Unable to use Location tags. Unlock your device, open Camera, then allow the relevant permissions and try again.
To use Camera, unlock your phone and go to Settings > Apps > Camera > Permissions, then allow the required permissions.
All Camera settings will be reset to their default settings. %1$s will be turned off to turn on %2$s.
To record sound through Bluetooth mics or control the camera with external devices, you need to allow Camera to access nearby devices in Settings.
To use Location tags, you need to allow Camera to access your location in Settings.
To use Single Take, allow the Storage permission for the Single Take app in Settings.
Save APV recordings in Fragmented MP4 format to reduce data loss if USB storage is disconnected. This limits recording time to 10 minutes.

Just point your camera at QR codes to add contacts, go to webpages, add calendar events, and more. You can also open the QR scanner in the quick panel.
Automatically adjust the color and contrast of photos to match the scene.
Automatically optimize camera settings to make dark scenes look brighter, food look tastier, and landscapes look more vivid.

Both views are saved as shown on screen. To save each view as a separate video, go to Camera settings.
Touch and hold filters to reorder or delete them.
Touch and hold filters to share, rename, reorder, or delete them.
Zooming in while using 50 MP results in a smaller resolution and file size.
Zooming in or shooting in low light while using 50 MP may result in a lower resolution image.
Log videos capture more color data for editing, but they look flat and gray until color corrected in Gallery. To preview the corrected look, tap the LUT icon above.
Log videos provide pro-level editing control but need color correction in Gallery.
Get pro-level editing control over all your videos by recording in Log format.
Zooming in while using 50 or 200 MP results in a smaller resolution and file size.
Zooming in or shooting in low light while using 50 or 200 MP may result in a lower resolution image.
